channel.title: Quick keys?
channel.description: hi can anyone help me with adding quick keys, such as having escape key bring u to the weapon style slot and f3 bringing you to the inventory, ect.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 12, 2009, 05:13:10 pm[/size][hr]anyone?

item.title: Quick keys?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

zyle1992:

3123 for inventory, 3124 for the actual frame that contains the items.

Ment the int that Forces the interfaces, as in tabs. Rofl

3123 for inventory, 3124 for the actual frame that contains the items.

item.title: Quick keys?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:308203”]Should already have it in it(or not) but all you need to do is go into the applet/frame class, set a KeyListener to the gui, then do something like:

frame.addKeyListener(new KeyListener() } public void keyPressed(KeyEvent event) { if(event.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_ESCAPE) { /** force inventory interface **/ } } }); [/quote]

No offense but i dont believe anybody on these forums knows about the int for interfaces.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick keys?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Should already have it in it(or not) but all you need to do is go into the applet/frame class, set a KeyListener to the gui, then do something like:

frame.addKeyListener(new KeyListener() }
    public void keyPressed(KeyEvent event) {
        if(event.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_ESCAPE) {
            /** force inventory interface **/
        }
    }
});

Read full topic
